summary: with %xx, e-mail address not same as specified in <a href="mailto:.."> tag
description:
test with Mozilla 1.0 RC1 (Build ID 2002041711)

try this href in <a>
   1. mailto:xyz@xyz.com?subject=(normal)
   2. mailto:%61xyz@xyz.com?subject=(front %61)
   3. mailto:%61%61xyz@xyz.com?subject=(front %61%61)
   4. mailto:xyz%61@xyz.com?subject=(rear %61)
   5. mailto:xyz%61%61@xyz.com?subject=(rear %61%61)
   6. mailto:%61xyz%61@xyz.com?subject=(front rear %61)
   7. mailto:%61%61xyz%61%61@xyz.com?subject=(front rear %61%61)
   8. mailto:xyz%20@xyz.com?subject=(rear %20)


each will brings new mail composer window with these attributes
   1. to = "xyz@xyz.com"
       subject = "(normal)"
   2. to = "axyz@xyz.com?s"
       subject = "(front a)"
   3. to = "aaxyz@xyz.com?sub"
       subject = "(front aa)"
   4. to = "xyza@xyz.com?s"
       subject ="(rear a)"
   5. to = "xyzaa@xyz.com?sub"
       subject = "(rear aa)"
   6. to = "axyza@xyz.com?sub"
       subject ="(front rear a)"
   7. to = "aaxyzaa@xyz.com?subject"
       subject = "(front rear aa)"
   8. to = "xyz", "@xyz.com?s"   *** 2 addresses ***
       subject = "(rear  )"

- "to" in items (2) to (8) is not the same as specified in html <a href=> tag.
- each %xx brings additional 2 chars after original e-mail address.
- if %xx is %20 and is in front of "@", e-mail address will be separated.
